title: How to Make a Whale on Apple Messages

steps.title: Open a conversation in Messages.
steps.content: Open a conversation in Messages. You can use Messages on your iPhone, iPad, or iPod Touch to send a whale.

steps.title: Tap 123 to open the Numbers keyboard.
steps.content: Tap 123 to open the Numbers keyboard. It’s at the bottom left side of the keyboard.

steps.title: Tap #+= to open the Symbols keyboard.
steps.content: Tap #+= to open the Symbols keyboard.

steps.title: Tap ∙ to create the whale’s left eye.
steps.content: Tap ∙ to create the whale’s left eye. This is the bullet symbol, which is the final button on the 2nd row of keys. [1] X Research source For a little variation, tap the - instead to make a winking whale. This is the first key on the 2nd row of the keyboard.

steps.title: Tap _ 21 times to create the whale’s mouth.
steps.content: Tap _ 21 times to create the whale’s mouth. This is the first key on the 2nd row.

steps.title: Tap ∙ to create the whale’s right eye.
steps.content: Tap ∙ to create the whale’s right eye. Again, use the bullet symbol.

steps.title: Tap the Send button.
steps.content: Tap the Send button. This is the blue button with the white arrow. For another variation, you could use - for both eyes to make a sleepy whale, or X to make a dead whale.

steps.title: Open a conversation in Messages.
steps.content: Open a conversation in Messages. You can use Messages on your iPhone, iPad, or iPod Touch to send a whale.

steps.title: Tap 123 to open the Numbers keyboard.
steps.content: Tap 123 to open the Numbers keyboard. It’s at the bottom left side of the keyboard.

steps.title: Tap #+= to open the Symbols keyboard.
steps.content: Tap #+= to open the Symbols keyboard.

steps.title: Tap ∙ to create the whale’s left eye.
steps.content: Tap ∙ to create the whale’s left eye. This is the bullet symbol, which is the final button on the 2nd row of keys.

steps.title: Tap _ 13 times to create the whale’s mouth.
steps.content: Tap _ 13 times to create the whale’s mouth. This is the first key on the 2nd row.

steps.title: Tap ∙ to create the whale’s right eye.
steps.content: Tap ∙ to create the whale’s right eye. Again, use the bullet symbol.

steps.title: Tap the Send button.
steps.content: Tap the Send button. This is the blue button with the white arrow. You can use different symbols to create the eyes of your baby whale to give it a different effect. For example, you could tap - (on the number keyboard) in place of both eyes to make it look sleepy.
